channel.title: CVE Feed for publishpress -- Co-Authors, Multiple Authors and Guest Authors in an Author Box with PublishPress Authors
channel.description: The latest CVEs for publishpress -- Co-Authors, Multiple Authors and Guest Authors in an Author Box with PublishPress Authors

item.title: CVE-2024-9215|2024-10-17T16:15:04.518Z -- publishpress -- co-authors%2C%20multiple%20authors%20and%20guest%20authors%20in%20an%20author%20box%20with%20publishpress%20authors
item.description: The Co-Authors, Multiple Authors and Guest Authors in an Author Box with PublishPress Authors plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference to Privilege Escalation/Account Takeover in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.1 via the action_edited_author() due to missing validation on the 'authors-user_id' user controlled key. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to update arbitrary user accounts email addresses, including administrators, which can then be leveraged to reset that user's account password and gain access.

item.title: CVE-2024-9215|2024-10-17T02:06:04.689Z -- publishpress -- co-authors%2C%20multiple%20authors%20and%20guest%20authors%20in%20an%20author%20box%20with%20publishpress%20authors
item.description: The Co-Authors, Multiple Authors and Guest Authors in an Author Box with PublishPress Authors plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference to Privilege Escalation/Account Takeover in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.1 via the action_edited_author() due to missing validation on the 'authors-user_id' user controlled key. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to update arbitrary user accounts email addresses, including administrators, which can then be leveraged to reset that user's account password and gain access.
